repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Counselor, special advisor, director of communications, and speech writer to U.S. Presidents Nixon, Ford, Reagan, and Clinton. Gergen has also worked as a journalist, serving as Editor-at-large of U.S. News and World Report and as a regular analyst on the "MacNeil/Lehrer NewsHour" and the "NewsHour with Jim Lehrer." A native of Durham, N.C., Gergen graduated from Yale University and the Harvard Law School and served for three-and-a-half years in the U.S. Navy. The collection includes materials from Gergen's career in politics as well as his journalism career. Among his political materials are presidential campaign materials for the 1972, 1976, 1980, and 1984 elections; subject files; office memos; chronological files and telephone logs; daily planners; and legal and financial papers; as well as drafts and transcripts of Gergen's and other's speeches. The collection includes 86 black-and-white and color photographs, 16 audio cassettes; and 106 video cassettes. Other materials document his journalism career, including editorials, interoffice memos, and other U.S. News and World Report documents; financial and subject files relating to his work as an analyst on the MacNeil/Lehrer NewsHour; speeches; correspondence, chronological files, and telephone logs; and financial papers. The addition contains 445 electronic computer files; 5 color and 40 black-and-white photographs; 16 slides; and 82 video cassettes; as well as 35 audio cassettes. The audio and video cassettes include interviews with Richard Nixon and Ross Perot.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
Also, some of the materials in this collection are not immediately accessible, because they require further processing before use.
All or part of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], David Richmond Gergen Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The David Richmond Gergen Papers was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2000.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned by Ruth E. Bryan; Kate Crassons; Ann G. Langford; Alice Poffinberger; Lisa C. Stark
Encoded by Ruth E. Bryan; Ming Guo; Sue-Ellen Katz; Mohammad Hutasuhut
This collection is unprocessed: materials may have not been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: This collection (74,159 items, dated 1964-1999) documents David Gergen's professional life as a speech writer, director of communications, and special counsel for U.S. Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon and for Presidents Nixon, Ford, and Reagan. The materials include presidential campaign materials for the 1972, 1976, 1980, and 1984 elections; subject files; office memos; chronological files and telephone logs; daily planners; and legal and financial papers; as well as drafts and transcripts of Gergen's and other's speeches. The collection includes 86 black-and-white and color photographs, 16 audio cassettes; and 106 video cassettes. (2000-0356)

The addition (47,269 items, dated 1987-1996) continues to document David Gergen's involvement in national politics, as both Counselor and Special Advisor to President Clinton from 1993 to 1995, and as a journalist. Materials include editorials, interoffice memos, and otherU.S. News and World Report documents; financial and subject files relating to his work as an analyst on the MacNeil/Lehrer NewsHour; speeches; correspondence, chronological files, and telephone logs; and financial papers. The addition contains 445 electronic computer files; 5 color and 40 black-and-white photographs; 16 slides; and 82 video cassettes; as well as 35 audio cassettes. The audio and video cassettes include interviews with Richard Nixon and Ross Perot. (2000-0415)

processinfo.p: Processing Notes: Gergen labeled many of the original boxes with numbers or written clarifications of their contents. The archivist kept these as the general type or subject of the processed boxes, even if the box did not seem to contain material related to the description on the outside. In cases where it was possible to discern the general content of miscellaneous, incorrectly labeled, unlabeled, or loose documents at either a box or folder level, that was done (often using brackets) while also keeping Gergen's labels. Folders have also been marked [Loose Material] or [Unlabeled Material] to maintain original order as much as possible. These folder titles, however, are not included in the box list. A supplementary container list provides greater intellectual access by rearranging the consecutively-numbered boxes of this list into broad subject categories. It is appended to this document.

Furthermore, please be aware that this collection is unprocessed. Items have not been refoldered, flattened, or rehoused; rusty paperclips and some mildew may remain on the materials; and sensitive materials have not been removed or separated from the collection.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is RESTRICTED: Researchers must obtain Gergen's permission before using any part of this collection.

Original audiovisual materials are closed to use. Use of these materials may require production of listening or viewing copies. Please contact a reference archivist before coming to use this collection.

processinfo.p: Attention: Some of the materials in this collection are not immediately accessible, because they require further processing before use. Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use the collection.

Processing Note: Gergen labeled many of the original boxes with numbers or written clarifications of their contents. We have kept these as the general type or subject of our processed boxes, even if the box does not seem to contain material related to the description on the outside. In cases where it was possible to discern the general content of miscellaneous, incorrectly labeled, unlabeled, or loose documents at either a box or folder level, we have done so (often using brackets) while also keeping Gergen's labels. Folders have also been marked [Loose Material] or[Unlabeled Material] to maintain original order as much as possible. These folder titles, however, are not included in the box list. A supplementary container list provides greater intellectual access by rearranging the current box numbers of this list into their original numbered series of boxes as imposed by Gergen . It is appended to this document.

Furthermore, please be aware that this collection is unprocessed. Items have not been refoldered, flattened, or rehoused; rusty paperclips and some mildew may remain on the materials; and sensitive materials have not been removed or separated from the collection.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is RESTRICTED: Researchers must obtain Gergen's permission before using any part of this collection. In addition, the collection contains sensitive material throughout, including public records.
